New Records: Jan Vertonghen's own goal was the decisive factor in France's 1-0 win over Belgium, sending Les Bleus into the quarter-finals of Euro 2024.
Key Match Events: Jan Vertonghen's own goal in the 85th minute proved decisive for France, Randal Kolo Muani's shot deflecting off Vertonghen and past Koen Casteels, Kevin De Bruyne's effort was kept out by Mike Maignan in the 84th minute, Romelu Lukaku's shot was pushed clear by Maignan in the 72nd minute, Theo Hernandez's tackle on Yannick Carrasco was a highlight of the match
Pre-Game Insights: France were expected to be the more proactive side, but Belgium's back five approach off the ball made it difficult for them to create clear chances
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps won't care about the lack of creativity or class in France's win, all that matters is that they got into the quarter-finals, Roy Keane reacted to Belgium's Euro 2024 exit saying it's tough on them and that France were the better team
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kevin De Bruyne may have played his last stand at Euro 2024, as he's been hampered by injuries and has a dwindling contract at club level, the game was described as the worst football in the tournament so far
